    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Zombie Shambler</h1>A zombie shambler is a slow-moving horror dangerous in larger groups.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Undead</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=13">Religion</a></u>)</b>: DC 13<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=423">Zombie Shambler</a><span style="float:right;">Creature -1</span></h1><span alt="Neutral Evil" class="traitalignment" title="Neutral Evil">NE</span><span alt="Medium" class="traitsize" title="Medium">Medium</span><span alt="Mindless Trait" class="trait" title="A mindless creature has either programmed or rudimentary mental attributes. Most, if not all, of their mental ability modifiers are –5. They are immune to all mental effects."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=108">Mindless</a></span><span alt="Undead Trait" class="trait" title="Once living, these creatures were infused after death with negative energy and soul-corrupting evil magic. When reduced to 0 Hit Points, an undead creature is destroyed. Undead creatures are damaged by positive energy, are healed by negative energy, and don’t benefit from healing effects."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=160">Undead</a></span><span alt="Zombie Trait" class="trait" title="These undead are mindless rotting corpses that hunger for living flesh."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=245">Zombie</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 340</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +0; darkvision<br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=3"><u>Athletics</a></u> +5<br /><b>Str</b> +3, <b>Dex</b> -2, <b>Con</b> +2, <b>Int</b> -5, <b>Wis</b> +0, <b>Cha</b> -2<br /><b>Slow</b> A zombie is permanently slowed 1 and can’t use reactions.<hr /><b>AC</b> 12, <b>Fort</b> +6, <b>Ref</b> +0, <b>Will</b> +2<br /><b>HP</b> 20 (negative healing); <b>Immunities</b> death effects, disease, mental, paralyzed, poison, unconscious; <b>Weaknesses</b> positive 5, slashing 5<hr /><b>Speed</b> 25 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> fist +7, <b>Damage</b> 1d6+3 bludgeoning plus Grab</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Jaws</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=15"><u>attack</a></u>) <b>Requirement</b> The zombie has a creature grabbed or restrained. <b>Effect</b> The zombie makes a jaws unarmed melee Strike against the grabbed or restrained creature with an attack modifier of +7 that deals 1d8+3 piercing damage.</span><h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=103">Zombie</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=424">Plague Zombie</a></td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=425">Zombie Brute</a></td><td>2</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=426">Zombie Hulk</a></td><td>6</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=423">Zombie Shambler</a></td><td>-1</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=103">Zombie</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 340</i></a><br />A zombie’s only desire is to consume the living. Unthinking and ever-shambling harbingers of death, zombies stop only when they’re destroyed. <h2 class="title">Zombie Abilities</h2> You can modify zombies with the following zombie abilities. Most zombies have one of these abilities; If you give a zombie more, you might want to increase its level and adjust its statistics.<br /> <b>Disgusting Pustules</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=46">disease</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=117">necromancy</a>) The zombie is covered in pustules that rupture when it takes any piercing damage or any critical hit. In either case, adjacent creatures are hit with vile fluid, causing them to become sickened 1 unless they succeed at a Fortitude save.<br /> <b>Feast</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Two Actions" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\TwoActions_I.png"> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=104">manipulate</a>) If the zombie is adjacent to a helpless or unconscious creature, or a deceased creature that died in the past hour, the zombie can feast upon its flesh to heal itself. This restores an amount of Hit Points equal to the zombie’s level. If the creature is alive, the zombie deals damage equal to its jaws, flst, or claw damage.<br /> <b>Plague-Ridden</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=46">disease</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=117">necromancy</a>) The zombie carries a plague that can create more of its own kind. This functions as the plague zombie’s zombie rot, except at stage 5, the victim rises as another of the zombie’s type, rather than a plague zombie.<br /> <b>Rotting Aura</b> (<a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=206">aura</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=46">disease</a>, <a style="text-decoration:underline" href="Traits.aspx?ID=117">necromancy</a>) The zombie emits an aura of rot and disease that causes wounds to fester and turn sour. Any living creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the zombie and is not at full Hit Points takes 1d6 damage as its wounds fester. This damage increases by 1d6 for every 6 levels the zombie has. Creatures that take a critical hit from the zombie also take this damage immediately.<br /> <b>Unkillable</b> This zombie is nigh unkillable. The zombie loses its weakness to slashing and gains resistance against all damage equal to its level (minimum 3), and it gains weakness equal to twice its level (minimum 6) to critical hits. Increase the zombie’s level by 1 if you give it this ability.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Advice and Rules" title="Sidebar - Advice and Rules" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_1_AdviceAndRules.png"> Creating Zombies</h3>To create a zombie creature, start with a zombie of the appropriate size. Then add any Strikes, Speeds, or other abilities it would gain from its shape. To create a Gargantuan zombie, begin with the zombie hulk, apply the elite adjustments, change its size to Gargantuan, and increase its reach by 5 feet.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Risen from the Grave</h3>Zombies are often created using unwholesome necromantic rituals. Among the living dead, zombies are most often used as fodder, wearing down defenses and consuming resources before more powerful undead arrive to deal the killing blow. Zombies cannot speak or really even think for themselves, but they can be commanded by other allied undead and powerful necromancers.</span>

  <script>
      initiateToggle(document.getElementById('theme-toggle'));
      initializeMenuToggle(document.getElementById('minMaxMenu'));
      var initializeSearch = function (search) {
          var button;
          var text;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-input'))
              text = search.lastElementChild;
          if (search.firstElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.firstElementChild;
          if (search.lastElementChild.classList.contains('search-button'))
              button = search.lastElementChild;

          if (search) {
              search.addEventListener('keypress', function (e) {
                  if (e.keyCode == 13) {
                      e.preventDefault();
                      if (text.value != null && text.value.length > 0)
                          window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
                  }
              })
          }
          if (button) {
              button.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
                  window.location = window.location.origin + "/Search.aspx?query=" + text.value;
              });
          }
      };
      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);
          toggle.addEventListener('click', function () {
              var expanded = target.classList.contains('expanded');
              expanded = !expanded;
              if (expanded) {
                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
